storyInfo: Lumen agrees to make a delivery on behalf of an injured Messenger, stirring the quiet waters of Gran Faro.

attributes.content: 'Out of safety considerations, the connector must be... the most suitable replacement material...'
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: The expected amount of materials needed... Could it be...?
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: No, these are early notes. She would have crossed them out if there were a mistake.
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: How big could this Eye of Iberia be?
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: When lit, its light would be seen from every single window in Gran Faro...
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: Now that's got to be a myth.
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: Luminosity testing... Well, the diagrams are very clear. Should only be a matter of following them.
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: But the town doesn't seem to have the materials needed for the prototype...
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: One second! Coming!
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: The young caretaker hastily stuffs the notebook into a drawer, picks up his lamp, and hurries through the chapel.
It's very late. What brings you to the—
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: —A Messenger?! What the...
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: Take it easy. You can lean on my shoulder.
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: Just sit down by the door. I have some clean gauze.
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: Close the door...
attributes.name: Local Messenger

attributes.content: A-Alright.
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: ...Clean cut. Took the belt with it.
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: I should be able to treat it.
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: But it'll be a few days before you can move again.
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: Phew...
attributes.name: Local Messenger

attributes.content: That was close.
attributes.name: Local Messenger

attributes.content: Yes, sir, it's good that you came quickly. There isn't much I could have done if the wound got infected.
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: You're not going to ask how I got hurt?
attributes.name: Local Messenger

attributes.content: Or is everyone in this town like this?
attributes.name: Local Messenger

attributes.content: I-I just thought stopping the bleeding was more urgent...
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: I don't really know how to answer that question, though. I don't know how things are anywhere else.
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: Very few people come to Gran Faro. And those who leave don't come back.
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: I guess that's the kind of place this is... Close to the sea, and close to the Inquisition.
attributes.name: Local Messenger

attributes.content: Exactly... even Messengers like you don't stay for long.
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: ...Sorry, I forgot to ask your name. Messengers come and go in a hurry; they don't often stop at the chapel.
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: I'm... ahem. Do you know Gran Faro well?
attributes.name: Local Messenger

attributes.content: I guess? I grew up here.
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: But as for the things that happened here a long time ago... about the plaza, the statue there, and the sea... I only know them through my uncle's stories.
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: That's plenty.
attributes.name: Local Messenger

attributes.content: Sorry to ask this of you after you've already done so much for me... but there's something I need help with.
attributes.name: Local Messenger

attributes.content: This package is for Gran Faro, but it doesn't say who exactly the recipient is or where they live, only 'the door with a white flower on it.'
attributes.name: Local Messenger

attributes.content: White flower? That doesn't ring a bell...
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: I'm afraid I'm not in any shape to go on a search around town for a few days.
attributes.name: Local Messenger

attributes.content: But I won't sleep easy until this package makes it to the recipient.
attributes.name: Local Messenger

attributes.content: Alright, leave it to me.
attributes.name: Jordi
Jordi
attributes.content: Whoa, it's heavy...

attributes.name: Jordi
attributes.content: I'll go once the sun rises.
attributes.joined: Whoa, it's heavy...I'll go once the sun rises.

attributes.content: I'll get you a couple more blankets. They're old, but they'll keep you warm.
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: Thank you.
attributes.name: Local Messenger

attributes.content: ...Be careful.
attributes.name: Local Messenger

attributes.content: Young folks this days are so careless! At this rate, they'll draw the Inquisition here, ruining the peace that we've had for the last twenty years!
attributes.name: Thiago

attributes.content: Always telling me to calm down and be reasonable... since when has the Inquisition been reasonable?!
attributes.name: Thiago

attributes.content: The rest of the soup is yours, lad. A bit too salty for my tastes... Anyway, be careful. Don't draw attention to yourself.
attributes.name: Thiago

attributes.content: Alright, Uncle Thiago. I'll take it easy with the salt next time.
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: ...Did something happen in town?
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: It's nothing, just people nosing about in Gran Faro again.
attributes.name: Thiago

attributes.content: Two snooping priests from the Inquisition. Heaven only knows what scent they're after.
attributes.name: Thiago

attributes.content: But whatever it is, Gran Faro doesn't have it. Can't they tell? There's nothing left here.
attributes.name: Thiago

attributes.content: ...Anything happen at the chapel? Are you still reading your parents' notes?
attributes.name: Thiago

attributes.content: Yeah... they're pretty interesting. The whole day went by before I knew it.
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: Don't let anyone see you reading them. They're in Ægirian, aren't they?
attributes.name: Thiago

attributes.content: I know, Uncle Thiago. I'll be careful.
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: ...*sigh*.
attributes.name: Thiago

attributes.content: I only left them there because I thought the most dangerous place to hide them would be the last place they'd look. I didn't want those Inquisition thugs taking everything from Gran Faro.
attributes.name: Thiago

attributes.content: I never even considered whether anyone would read them.
attributes.name: Thiago

attributes.content: But I suppose it's worth it, if it helps you pass the time.
attributes.name: Thiago

attributes.content: I'm really grateful that you preserved them.
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: By the way, there was a visitor at the chapel—
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: Thiago! Are you there? There's something we need to deal with before the Inquisition sets its eyes on our town!
attributes.name: Voice Outside the Door

attributes.content: (Whisper) Jordi!
attributes.name: Thiago

attributes.content: A-Alright! I'll stay in my room and lock the door...
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: Apparently, those priests were chasing a Messenger, not one of us.
attributes.name: Excitable Townsfolk

attributes.content: The problem is, they suspect him of carrying messages for the Ægir.
attributes.name: Excitable Townsfolk

attributes.content: ...Don't give me that look, Thiago. We've got nothing against the Ægir; it's them, not us.
attributes.name: Excitable Townsfolk

attributes.content: Anyway, we went to the chapel. The Messenger got hurt in a scuffle with the priests and took refuge there.
attributes.name: Excitable Townsfolk

attributes.content: ...The chapel?
attributes.name: Thiago

attributes.content: Don't worry, we waited for Jordi to leave before we brought them there. No one said a word about him.
attributes.name: Excitable Townsfolk

attributes.content: We all like the kid. We're not about to drag him into this mess.
attributes.name: Excitable Townsfolk

attributes.content: Anyway, the Messenger gave up his luggage for the priests to search through. They didn't find anything suspicious, though.
attributes.name: Excitable Townsfolk

attributes.content: Probably another misunderstanding.
attributes.name: Excitable Townsfolk

attributes.content: Ha, a misunderstanding!
attributes.name: Thiago

attributes.content: ...Alright, I get what's going on.
attributes.name: Thiago

attributes.content: Let's keep our heads low for a few days. Don't even bring it up.
attributes.name: Thiago

attributes.content: Once this blows over, it'll be as though nothing ever happened. The Inquisition won't bother us again.
attributes.name: Thiago

attributes.content: Alright, I'll let the others know.
attributes.name: Excitable Townsfolk

attributes.content: A suspicious package sent by an Ægir...
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: Jordi picks up the package behind the door, wrapped in dark-green cloth, and takes a sniff.
Did the smell of salt come from the bundle in his hands, or from the damp air enveloping Gran Faro throughout the four seasons?
...I'll go look myself.
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: The townsfolk are all good people. I don't think they'd do anything so bad that they should be taken away.
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: Uncle Thiago told me many Ægir used to live here. Maybe someone sent this to a friend, not knowing they had moved away.
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: I... I'll find out who the recipient is!
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: So, nothing on the east side of the plaza.
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: I'll save the rest for tomorrow morning... Uncle said those priests start patrolling at 7 am. I should get home quickly.
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: Hopefully they'll be leaving soon... It's been three days, after all.
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: A door with a white flower on it... but most of the houses here are painted white anyway. A white flower wouldn't go well with them.
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: Wait, did I see something white by the door of that one?
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: Oh, I guess I was mistaken...
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: It's not a flower, but... a book?
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: Weird... no one has lived here for a long time, but the book is new.
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: Let's see... I'll try knocking.
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: ...Sounds like there's no one here.
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: Still no answer. Guess I must have been overthinking this.
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: I'll go up this street. You take the other side. Kick the door in if something doesn't look right.
attributes.name: Unfamiliar Voice

attributes.content: This is the only part of town that we haven't searched.
attributes.name: Unfamiliar Voice

attributes.content: (Unfamiliar voice, unfamiliar accent... must be those priests.)
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: (I have to hide!)
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: (I might run into them if I head back this way.)
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: (It would be a headache for Uncle Thiago if they find me...)
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: (The footsteps are getting closer.)
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: Good morning. Visitors here are few and far between, much less one so accomplished at such a young age.
attributes.name: Gentle Female Voice

attributes.content: (The door opened? And I've heard that voice before...)
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: My accomplishments pale in comparison to those who've already reached the rank of Inquisitor at my age.
attributes.name: Young Priest

attributes.content: You seem to share our faith more than most of the residents here, rather than simply blindly fearing the judgment of the Inquisition.
attributes.name: Young Priest

attributes.content: I've gained a smattering of knowledge from the works I've read. At the very least I know what the Inquisition is up against.
attributes.name: Amaia

attributes.content: If what you fear is really in this town, I suggest you look over that way.
attributes.name: Amaia

attributes.content: You have a lead?
attributes.name: Young Priest

attributes.content: No, I've never seen anything out of the ordinary. That's why I chose to live here, in this quiet town, where I can focus on my work.
attributes.name: Amaia

attributes.content: However, the sea is that way.
attributes.name: Amaia

attributes.content: You mean it could only be outside of town... I see. Of course, that is more than ordinary priests like us can handle.
attributes.name: Young Priest

attributes.content: Good morning, Jordi from the chapel.
attributes.name: Amaia

attributes.content: Er, good morning.
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: Just a question... is this package for you?
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: Why yes, it is. Thank you.
attributes.name: Amaia

attributes.content: Phew, glad to know.
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: I'll be going, then.
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: Don't you want to know what's inside?
attributes.name: Amaia

attributes.content: Huh? Oh, no, of course I'm not suspecting you.
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: You're more knowledgeable than anyone in Gran Faro. Uncle Thiago said you've given him a lot of good ideas.
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: It's okay. You can come in. It can't hurt to set your mind at ease, can it?
attributes.name: Amaia

attributes.content: I had this abandoned house patched up to hold all the documents I don't have space for at home.
attributes.name: Amaia

attributes.content: And... perhaps someone would come here, someday, to read the stories of Gran Faro, Iberia, and beyond.
attributes.name: Amaia

attributes.content: The package you delivered was more books.
attributes.name: Amaia

attributes.content: It's in Ægirian. Can you read it?
attributes.name: Amaia

attributes.content: Er... barely, I guess.
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: ...So it really was sent by an Ægir.
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: Feel free to peruse it, if you like. Since you can read it.
attributes.name: Amaia

attributes.content: This one is about plays... some sort of stage setup...
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: Designs for a theater... they look amazing.
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: Are you studying drama, Ms. Amaia?
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: Of course not. I'm but a humble translator.
attributes.name: Amaia

attributes.content: A friend of mine found these lying around at home. Some Ægir must have written them from memory after the disaster.
attributes.name: Amaia

attributes.content: Disaster?
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: Ah, never mind.
attributes.name: Amaia

attributes.content: Anyway, she sent them to me, hoping I could translate them into Iberian.
attributes.name: Amaia

attributes.content: It's hard to preserve the writings of the Ægir in this land-bound country, after all.
attributes.name: Amaia

attributes.content: Ah, yes, it could cause misunderstandings if they were seen by priests who don't know Ægirian.
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: ...You sounded sad. Is it because of what happened to the Ægir?
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: Perhaps... but it's more than just them.
attributes.name: Amaia

attributes.content: Well, I've gotten used to this life... I'm fine with it.
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: I know I can't exactly speak for all Ægir, though.
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: Do others also live like this, in other places?
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: What it's like in other places... Well, Jordi, would you like to help me with the translation, seeing how you're the only Ægir here?
attributes.name: Amaia

attributes.content: It would certainly save me from having to flip through that old dictionary so much.
attributes.name: Amaia

attributes.content: Huh? I-I'm not sure I can handle something so difficult...
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: It's okay. You can just help out anytime you feel like it.
attributes.name: Amaia

attributes.content: You can also look through any books here that catch your eye, of course.
attributes.name: Amaia

attributes.content: Words may deceive at times, but it's undeniable that they break through barriers and unlock new possibilities.
attributes.name: Amaia

attributes.content: Including things regarding the world outside that you're so curious about.
attributes.name: Amaia

attributes.content: Now, where did my teapot go? Have a seat, Jordi. Stay a while, and you may find something that interests you here.
attributes.name: Amaia

attributes.content: Sorry, I have to get back to the chapel. Someone needs to care for that injured Messenger.
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: Thank you for the offer... but I need to do my job as a nurse first.
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: That young man... does he not understand?
attributes.name: Amaia

attributes.content: Has he not dreamed of having wings, gazing at the boundless ocean from above, at the waves melting back into the water?
attributes.name: Amaia

attributes.content: Jordi? Where did you go?
attributes.name: Thiago

attributes.content: You said you would be back before 7. I told you to stay put. Those priests are probably leaving today.
attributes.name: Thiago

attributes.content: S-Sorry, Uncle.
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: I was going to tend to the Messenger, then stay inside.
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: Those young folks already saw to the Messenger. They want you to stay home without worrying about him.
attributes.name: Thiago

attributes.content: Alright, I'll thank them next time... I'll stay put here today.
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: I'll be right here, okay? I'll close the door and read under the lamp.
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: That lamp... it works?
attributes.name: Thiago

attributes.content: I just followed what it said in the notes. I don't know if it's actually fixed, but it's giving out light now.
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.text: 'I heard about it, Thiago. You folks are erecting a proud new building on land, while we go and rebuild the Eye of Iberia.'
'I saw the foundations. They are deep. Perhaps it will be a reminder of Iberia's Golden Age, when it's finished.'
'Gran Faro will not be so grey and dull when we return. The lighthouse will shine here, and the Inquisition will build this place up.'
'Can I ask you something, Thiago? Try to hang this lamp in that building somewhere.'
'That way, I can be a part of its construction too.'

attributes.content: I'm sorry I couldn't hang the lamp here... not in this chapel that the Inquisition uses to spy on Gran Faro.
It's broken, anyway, ever since the night the Penal Battalion garrison charged out from the chapel.
I'll put it in a box with your notes. Maybe they'll be preserved, if they're lucky, but I dare not pray for it.
...Keep reading, lad.
attributes.name: Thiago

attributes.content: I'll be going.
attributes.name: Thiago

attributes.content: Oh, Mr. Messenger. You're awake.
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: Those priests have left Gran Faro. No need to worry now.
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: And I delivered the package. Don't worry, I saw what was in it, and it was nothing bad. It's all a misunderstanding.
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: ...Rald.
attributes.name: Local Messenger

attributes.content: Huh?
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: My name is Rald.
attributes.name: Local Messenger

attributes.content: Sorry. Being a Messenger tends to bring its share of trouble, and I didn't want any more of it than necessary.
attributes.name: Local Messenger

attributes.content: ...I'm Jordi. And I understand.
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: Anyway, your wounds are healing well. You should be able to move around normally in a couple of days.
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: Thank you.
attributes.name: Local Messenger

attributes.content: Do you like this place, Jordi?
attributes.name: Local Messenger

attributes.content: I... I don't know. Why do you ask?
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: This place is too close to the Inquisition, and maybe has had too much history with it. It's filled with danger, and forced to remain in this gloomy state.
attributes.name: Local Messenger

attributes.content: Especially for an Ægir.
attributes.name: Local Messenger

attributes.content: I don't want to spend one more day here than I have to. Have you never thought about leaving, and seeing what's out there?
attributes.name: Local Messenger

attributes.content: You could come with me, if you don't know where to go.
attributes.name: Local Messenger

attributes.content: The northern wilds may seem dangerous, but I know a relatively safe way.
attributes.name: Local Messenger

attributes.content: I also know a few cities that are more tolerant of the Ægir.
attributes.name: Local Messenger

attributes.content: Ægir like you have a chance to dream, and realize those dreams.
attributes.name: Local Messenger

attributes.content: Dreams...
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: Do people out there know the sea better?
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: Do they talk about the great lighthouse, about the legend of the Eye of Iberia?
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: Don't be silly, Jordi. The people don't really talk about the sea. As for the great lighthouse, that's a nursery tale that the people of Gran Faro tell their children.
attributes.name: Local Messenger

attributes.content: ...I see.
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: Thank you for the offer, Rald.
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: But I can't go, not until I've seen the sea and the lighthouse.
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: Gran Faro has failed. The dream of Iberia's Golden Age ended decades ago.
attributes.name: Local Messenger

attributes.content: Don't say that.
attributes.name: Jordi
Jordi
attributes.content: It's not just a dream for Iberia. It's also a dream for the Ægir...

attributes.name: Jordi
attributes.content: ...For one Ægir.
attributes.joined: It's not just a dream for Iberia. It's also a dream for the Ægir......For one Ægir.
